metadata.synopsis: Children and an outcast old man (Paul Scofield) try to lift a British isle's curse by saving a stranded narwhal in 1914.

reviews: English film that powerfully and practically speaks to the communal dimension of our responsibility to the natural world.

Loving the whales and loving this movie are two different enterprises, and to the degree that When the Whales Came makes the fate of the whales seem like a dreary and boring subject, it is likely to harm the cause.
